questions.text: In terms of size, how does Canada rank?
questions.reference: Canada is the second largest country on earth
questions.explanation: Canada is the second largest country by total area.

questions.text: How big is Canada?
questions.reference: 10 million square kilometres
questions.explanation: Canada covers approximately 10 million square kilometres.

questions.text: Which oceans line Canada's frontiers?
choices: Pacific Ocean, Atlantic Ocean and Southern Ocean
Pacific Ocean, Atlantic Ocean and Arctic Ocean
questions.reference: Three oceans line Canada’s frontiers: the Pacific Ocean in the west, the Atlantic Ocean in the east, and the Arctic Ocean to the north.
questions.explanation: Canada is bordered by the Pacific, Atlantic, and Arctic Oceans.

questions.text: Which country lies on Canada's southern border?
questions.reference: Along the southern edge of Canada lies the Canada-United States boundary
questions.explanation: The United States lies on Canada's southern border.

questions.text: What are the regions of Canada?
choices: Atlantic Provinces, Central Canada, Prairie Provinces, West Coast and Northern Territories
South Provinces, Northern Canada, West Provinces, East Provinces, and Central Territories
Ontario, Quebec, Prairie Provinces and Central Canada
Atlantic Provinces, Central Canada, Prairie Provinces, and West Coast
questions.reference: •	The Atlantic Provinces •	Central Canada •	The Prairie Provinces •	The West Coast •	The Northern Territories
questions.explanation: Canada is divided into these regions for administrative purposes.

questions.text: What is Canada's national capital?
questions.reference: Ottawa, located on the Ottawa River, was chosen as the capital
questions.explanation: Ottawa is the capital city of Canada.

questions.text: When was Ottawa chosen as the capital of Canada?
questions.reference: Ottawa, located on the Ottawa River, was chosen as the capital in 1857
questions.explanation: Ottawa was chosen as the capital in 1857.

questions.text: Who chose Ottawa as the capital of Canada?
questions.reference: Ottawa, located on the Ottawa River, was chosen as the capital in 1857 by Queen Victoria, the great-great-grandmother of Queen Elizabeth II.
questions.explanation: Queen Victoria chose Ottawa as the capital.

questions.text: In terms of size, how does Ottawa's metropolitan area rank in Canada?
questions.reference: Today it is Canada’s fourth largest metropolitan area.
questions.explanation: Ottawa's metropolitan area is the fourth largest in Canada.

questions.text: How many provinces and territories are there in Canada?
questions.reference: Canada has ten provinces and three territories.
questions.explanation: Canada has ten provinces and three territories.

questions.text: In Canada, each province and territory has its own capital city.
questions.reference: Each province and territory has its own capital city.

questions.text: In Canada, where do more than half of the people live?

questions.explanation: More than half of the people in Canada live in Central Canada.

questions.text: Which part of Canada is sometimes called the "Land of the Midnight Sun"?

questions.text: Why is the North sometimes called the "Land of the Midnight Sun"?
choices: Daylight can last up to 24 hours in fall
Daylight can last up to 24 hours in winter
Daylight can last up to 24 hours in summer
Daylight can last up to 24 hours in spring
questions.reference: because at the height of summer, daylight can last up to 24 hours.
questions.explanation: Daylight can last up to 24 hours in summer in the North.

Sir William Logan, a world-famous mountain climber

Sir William Logan, a world-famous pioneer
